summary: This document is an email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding discovery issues in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It discusses technical problems with document productions, including bates numbering gaps, corrupt files, and logistics for delivering corrected materials to Maxwell at the MDC.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, raising discovery issues and coordinating document production logistics.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP copied on discovery correspondence regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on discovery correspondence regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on discovery correspondence regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney (MDC counsel) copied on discovery correspondence regarding delivering materials to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case, held at MDC, for whom discovery materials are being produced and corrected.

persons.name: Rohrer
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York handling discovery production and technical issues.

persons.name: Thomas J. Powers
persons.context: Individual mentioned in the email chain regarding discovery issues.

connections.description: Everdell is part of Maxwell's defense team, communicating about discovery materials for her case.
Cohen is part of Maxwell's defense team, copied on discovery correspondence.
Pagliuca is part of Maxwell's defense team, copied on discovery correspondence.
Menninger is part of Maxwell's defense team, copied on discovery correspondence.
Sternheim is identified as MDC counsel for Maxwell, involved in receiving discovery materials.
Rohrer is the prosecutor handling discovery production for the case against Maxwell.
Defense attorney and prosecutor communicating about technical discovery issues in the Maxwell case.

events.title: First Discovery Production
events.description: Initial production of discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, later found to have bates numbering gaps.

events.title: Second Discovery Production
events.description: Second production of discovery materials with identified numbering issues.

events.title: Third Discovery Production
events.description: Third production of discovery materials, some of which were reproduced on September 3, 2020.

events.title: Discovery Production with Errors
events.description: Production containing overlapping bates numbers and corrupt .tif files that needed correction.

events.title: Discovery Issue Resolution
events.description: Email correspondence coordinating the correction and delivery of discovery materials to defense counsel and Maxwell at MDC.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing discovery issues in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, including bates numbering gaps, corrupt files, and overlapping document numbers.
Prosecutors provided a password (USAOsdnyll) for an encrypted zip file containing discovery materials.
Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) and required separate delivery of discovery materials to her location.
The defense team included Christian Everdell, Mark S. Cohen, Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, and Bobbi C Sternheim (MDC counsel).
Prosecutors acknowledged technical errors in loading prior productions and offered to reproduce documents as a courtesy.
